item.description:
Thursday nights at the ICA are free, sponsored by Target. I will lead a small group and we spend about 1/2 hour seeking out the digital art works in the ICA's collection. Afterwards, we can find a table in the museum's cafe for a drink or snack. We will meet at 7 pm and will be finished around 8 or 8:30.

The ICA is located near the Courthouse MBTA stop (Take the silverline one stop from South Station). Parking is available nearby.

Here are some of the highlights we will view:

"Exit Strategy" Video, Catherine D'Ignazio. The artist records herself walking the ICA evacuation routes.

"The Hunt" Video, Christian Jankowski. Segments from a week long quest to eat only groceries shot in the supermarket with a bow and arrow.

"Oil and Sugar #2" Video, Kader Attia. Hypnotic video of sugar cubes slowly dissolved by motor oil.

"1st Light" Animation, Paul Chan. Projected images of silhouetted figures drift downward across the floor.

"Suzanne walking in a leather skirt" Animation, Julian Opie. Minimalist animation captures the style of an individual's movement.

Other artworks worth checking out are a photography and film exhibit about Loch Ness Monster imagery, "Hanging Fire," a 3D sculpture constructed from charred wood, and "Czech Modernism Mirror and Reflected Infinitely," a display of Czech art using lighting and mirror tricks.
item.how_to_find_us: Directions and details for meeting will be emailed to participants on Wed.

group.name: The Boston Digital Arts Meetup Group

item.name: Free Night at the ICA Museum - Update
